title: Forever101
author: Forever101
content: I want to request this from every one. I know there are a lot of newbie on the forum and they have been hearing and reading about bitcoins, many are aware of the coming halving and the expected bull market afterward. So just thought of it that, it is better if newbie learn this before the bull run though that is still far ahead. I want the link to all the thread that talks about how to buy bitcoins, how to sell bitcoins, when to buy more, how to use exchange, how to use non custodial wallets, difference between custodial and non custodial wallet, how to transfer bitcoins from one wallet address to the other and so on. Drop the thread that is very important to newbie growth and safety. Threads that can help newbie maximize their opportunity in next bull run. I know their is search bar , let's make it easier. There are thread that are 5 years old but still useful, if you have them drop their link, let's learn together. Threads on why bitcoins should be preferred to other altcoins.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: All you need is the  Beginners & Help Encyclopedia by Ratimov. This thread is usually updated every month and encompasses almost all the threads needed for a beginner to kick start his cryptocurrency journey, or to gain more knowledge.

comments.author: blue Snow
comments.body: Quote from: Forever101 on October 18, 2023, 08:34:30 PMmany are aware of the coming halving and the expected bull market afterward. No, don't expect too much. It's not necessarily Halving is expecting to bull market afterward, because market condition today is different from previous halving. The world is in a condition of war, where we never met it before. All big country like the US and Europe just focus their economies on war, they prepare to cash just to meet what they need into the war. The world is not in good condition, the economy is in a state of chaos, and some observers say That the big country's economy will experience many problems. the big country will run out of cash for war costs. they prefer to cash than bitcoin.So, you have to add a link to how to manage your psychology on the crash market.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on October 18, 2023, 08:38:29 PMIf you want the links to those thread then do it yourself. Use Ninjastic.space and search for them and link them to your thread since you want to help out newbies. It may not be your intention, but this sounds rude. OP is just asking if you know of threads pertaining to certain topics and if you do you may share them here. I don't see anything wrong with that, especially considering that there are numerous topics mentioned. Anyway, OP, shouldn't newbies be concerned first about the whats and the whys and the hows of Bitcoin rather than about "maximiz[ing] their opportunity in next bull run"? For me, a newbie is one who is still learning the basics of Bitcoin. Making money out of Bitcoin is probably best for those who have gone past the newbie stage.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: Forever101 on October 18, 2023, 08:34:30 PMThreads that can help newbie maximize their opportunity in next bull run.They must do their research on history, past market cycles of Bitcoin. How its bull run starts together with a Bitcoin halving and how long it usually lasts, how long a bear market after that usually lasts.Understand those historic basics will help them to don't expect too much about new all time high price, have good plan to take profit, keep their capital in cash and be well prepared for a long bear market that often lasts for 2 years or longer.Look at the price chart first, read some past fuds like "Bitcoin is dead" and understand how fud works in this market as well as how strong Bitcoin is.https://99bitcoins.com/bitcoin-obituaries/https://buybitcoinworldwide.com/bitcoin-is-dead/If they don't know about Bitcoin 4-year cycle, it's time to explore it.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: Quote from: Zaguru12 on October 18, 2023, 08:37:41 PMAll you need is the  Beginners & Help Encyclopedia by Ratimov. This thread is usually updated every month and encompasses almost all the threads needed for a beginner to kick start his cryptocurrency journey, or to gain more knowledge. Thanks for sharing this Ratimov thread, it's really an encyclopedia, and merits the name. Just a glance into it and I've seen a lot of interesting bitcoin related topics that are worth looking into, to gain more knowledge. Aside from this encyclopedia, another fast and easy way for a newbie to Learn and increase knowledge of any bitcoin related issues, including halving and ATH is just to start a topic on the specific area where they need help. They'd be surprised at how fast more experienced members are willing to answer their question from different perspectives, and they will have enough knowledge and information to make their decisions. I'm talking from experience, because the only thing I knew about bitcoin before joining this forum was that the coin is traded like forex, nothing more. This bitcointalk forum is like an interactive institution where you learn about bitcoin and other related topics for free, so a newbie only need to search and ask questions about any bitcoin information, and answers will be pouring in.
